required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Panitumumab for Intravenous Infusion 100 mg and 400 mg Special Drug Use Surveillance "Survey on Unresectable, Advanced or Recurrent Colorectal Cancer With Wild-type KRAS Gene" (All-patient Surveillance)
clinical_study.official_title: Vectibix for Intravenous Infusion 100 mg and 400 mg Special Drug Use Surveillance "Survey on Unresectable, Advanced or Recurrent Colorectal Cancer With Wild-type KRAS Gene" (All-patient Surveillance)

brief_summary.textblock:
The efficacy and safety of panitumumab (Vectibix) in the routine clinical setting will be studied.
Specifically, information will be collected on the following as events of interest: skin disorders, interstitial lung disease, infusion reactions, electrolyte abnormalities, and cardiac disorders.

detailed_description.textblock:
The efficacy and safety of panitumumab (Vectibix) in the routine clinical setting will be studied.
Participants of this surveillance will be patients with unresectable, advanced or recurrent colorectal cancer with the wild-type KRAS gene. The planned sample size is 2,000 patients.
The usual adult dosage is 6 mg/kg of panitumumab given by intravenous drip infusion over a 60-minute period once every 2 weeks. The dosage may also be reduced as needed, depending on the patient's condition.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants with adverse drug reactions reported during the observation period were tabulated by type, seriousness, and time of onset. . Adverse events are defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product reported from first dose of study drug to the last dose of study drug.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Week 42 or death (whichever occurred first)
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free Survival (PFS) was defined as the time from the first day of study treatment to documented disease progression or death on study. For participants who experienced no disease progression and did not die while on study, data were censored at the date of the last tumor assessment. Kaplan-Meier methodology was used to estimate PFS.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Week 42 or death (whichever occurred first)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the time to death from the start of panitumumab administration was tabulated.

arm_group.description: Panitumumab 6 mg/kg, intravenous drip infusion over a 60-minute period, once every 2 weeks

study_pop.textblock: Unresectable, advanced or recurrent colorectal cancer with wild-type KRAS gene

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unresectable, advanced or recurrent colorectal cancer with wild-type KRAS gene
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a medical history of severe hypersensitivity to any of the ingredients of Vectibix

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants enrolled during the period from June 1, 2010 to November 14, 2010 were surveyed.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Surveyed participants had a clinical diagnosis of wild-type KRAS unresectable advanced/recurrent colorectal cancer.

group.title: Panitumumab
group.description: Panitumumab 6 mg/kg, intravenous drip infusion over a 60-minute period, once every 2 weeks for up to 42 weeks

baseline.population: 3086 participants completed the survey form (5 participants did not complete it). 3085 participants were included in the safety analysis set after excluding 1 participant due to missing panitumumab treatment and AE data. From that set, 3084 participants were included in the efficacy analysis set after excluding 1 participant with missing data.

group.title: Panitumumab
group.description: Panitumumab 6 mg/kg, intravenous drip infusion over a 60-minute period, once every 2 weeks for up to 42 weeks

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status (ECOG-PS) at baseline
measure.description: ECOG-PS is measured on 6-point scale to assess participant's performance status. 0=Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease activities without restriction; 1=Restricted in physically strenuous activity, but ambulatory and able to carry out light or sedentary work; 2=Ambulatory (>50% of waking hours), capable of all selfcare, but unable to carry out any work activities; 3=Capable of only limited selfcare, confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours; 4=Completely disabled, cannot carry on any selfcare, totally confined to bed or chair; 5=Dead.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions
outcome.description: The number of participants with adverse drug reactions reported during the observation period were tabulated by type, seriousness, and time of onset. . Adverse events are defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product reported from first dose of study drug to the last dose of study drug.
outcome.population: Of the 3086 participants who completed the survey form, 3085 participants were included in the safety analysis set after excluding 1 participant for whom information regarding panitumumab treatment and adverse events were missing.

group.title: Panitumumab
group.description: Panitumumab 6 mg/kg, intravenous drip infusion over a 60-minute period, once every 2 weeks for up to 42 weeks

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Drug Reactions
measure.description: The number of participants with adverse drug reactions reported during the observation period were tabulated by type, seriousness, and time of onset. . Adverse events are defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom or disease temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product reported from first dose of study drug to the last dose of study drug.
measure.population: Of the 3086 participants who completed the survey form, 3085 participants were included in the safety analysis set after excluding 1 participant for whom information regarding panitumumab treatment and adverse events were missing.

class.title: MedDRA SOC: Skin and subcutaneous tissue disorders
MedDRA SOC: Metabolism and nutrition disorders

outcome.title: Progression-free Survival
outcome.description: Progression-free Survival (PFS) was defined as the time from the first day of study treatment to documented disease progression or death on study. For participants who experienced no disease progression and did not die while on study, data were censored at the date of the last tumor assessment. Kaplan-Meier methodology was used to estimate PFS.
outcome.time_frame: Up to Week 42 or death (whichever occurred first)
outcome.population: Participants who were included in the efficacy analysis set and received panitumumab monotherapy as a third-line or later therapy.

group.title: Panitumumab
group.description: Panitumumab 6 mg/kg, intravenous drip infusion over a 60-minute period, once every 2 weeks for up to 42 weeks

measure.title: Progression-free Survival
measure.description: Progression-free Survival (PFS) was defined as the time from the first day of study treatment to documented disease progression or death on study. For participants who experienced no disease progression and did not die while on study, data were censored at the date of the last tumor assessment. Kaplan-Meier methodology was used to estimate PFS.
measure.population: Participants who were included in the efficacy analysis set and received panitumumab monotherapy as a third-line or later therapy.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the time to death from the start of panitumumab administration was tabulated.
outcome.time_frame: Up to Week 42 or death (whichever occurred first)
outcome.population: All participants that received panitumumab monotherapy as a third-line or later therapy.

group.title: Panitumumab
group.description: Panitumumab 6 mg/kg, intravenous drip infusion over a 60-minute period, once every 2 weeks for up to 42 weeks

measure.title: Overall Survival
measure.description: Overall survival was defined as the time to death from the start of panitumumab administration was tabulated.
measure.population: All participants that received panitumumab monotherapy as a third-line or later therapy.

reported_events.desc: Serious adverse events were tabulated dividing into 2 groups: panitumumab monotherapy or concomitant administration of panitumumab and chemotherapy Serious adverse events grouped by organ system, with number and frequency of such events.

group.title: Panitumumab
group.description: Panitumumab 6 mg/kg, intravenous drip infusion over a 60-minute period, once every 2 weeks for up to 42 weeks

group.title: Concomitant Administration of Panitumumab and Chemotherapy

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The first study related publication will be a multi-center publication submitted within 24 months after conclusion or termination of a study at all sites. After such multi site publication, all proposed site publications and presentations will be submitted to sponsor for review 60 days in advance of publication. Site will remove Sponsor confidential information unrelated to study results. Sponsor can delay a proposed publication for another 60 days to preserve intellectual property.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The present specified drug-use survey is a one-arm observational study with no control group. Therefore, the observed outcome measures provide exploratory information regarding these endpoints; however, do not constitute verification results.
